action.action-desc: Mr. Fitzgerald (for himself, Ms. Foxx, Mr. Duncan, Mr. Waltz, Mr. Posey, Mr. Tiffany, Mr. Gimenez, Mr. Issa, Mr. Guest, Mr. Bishop of North Carolina, Mr. Steil, Mr. Carey, Mr. Clyde, Ms. Salazar, Mr. Bost, Mr. Perry, Mr. Smith of New Jersey, Mr. Jackson of Texas, Mr. Hunt, and Mr. Gaetz) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to ensure that local educational agencies applying for certain Federal education funds post the curriculum for elementary and secondary schools online, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Curriculum Review of Teachings Transparency Act or the CRT Transparency Act.

section.header: State and local educational agency plans

subsection.text: Section 1111(g)(2) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6311(g)(2)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (M), by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (N), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: the State will ensure that each local educational agency in the State posts the curriculum for each elementary school and secondary school grade level on a publicly accessible website of the agency.

subsection.text: Section 1112(c) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6312(c)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (6), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (7), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
post the curriculum for each elementary school and secondary school grade level on a publicly accessible website of the agency.
